definition: (film) a still picture that is introduced and that interrupts the action of a film, introduce
details:
noun
- (film) a still picture that is introduced and that interrupts the action of a film
= synonyms: cut-in
- (broadcasting) a local announcement inserted into a network program
= synonyms: cut-in
- an artifact that is inserted or is to be inserted
= synonyms: inset
- a folded section placed between the leaves of another publication
verb
- introduce
= synonyms: present, pose, enclose, inclose, stick in, put in, introduce, interpose
- insert casually
= synonyms: stick in, slip in, sneak in
- fit snugly into
= example: fit snugly into
= synonyms: tuck
- put or introduce into something
= example: put or introduce into something
= synonyms: infix, introduce, enter
